settings.title: Setting up Telegram bot
settings.already_registered_own_bot: Your Homey is already registered with your own custom bot on Telegram.
settings.own_bot_description:
It is required to set up your own Telegram bot. It is not hard, but it is a little bit more work. However, this makes communication fully secure: if you use the @athomhomey_bot it is theoretically possible that we read the communication on the bot.
By setting up your own bot, this is not possible.

To set up your own bot, follow these steps:
settings.step1: 1. Open a chat with Botfather using the Telegram app.
settings.step2: 2. Create a new bot with /newbot. It will ask for a name and a username (must end with .....bot).
settings.step3: 3. When created a token is given to you. Copy the token, save it to the field below.
settings.step4: 4. Set your privacy settings with /setprivacy (is default on enabled, which is ok, but just to be sure....)
settings.step5: 5. When a private bot is made in Telegram, the bot can be added to groups by default. To change this send '/setjoingroups' in the chat with BotFather and set it to 'Disable', or leave it enabled if you want to be able to add the bot to a group chat.
settings.step6: 6. Use the button below to save this. Homey will connect to the Telegram bot and set a 'webhook' so Homey will be called when the Telegram bot receives a message.
settings.step7: 7. Send the register command to your Homey bot:
settings.step8: 8. Send a message 'ping' to the bot. If all is well, you will receive a message 'pong' from Homey!
settings.success: Successfully setup your bot for Homey!
